1.text: When you sit to eat with a ruler, consider diligently what is before you;

2.text: put a knife to your throat, if you are a man given to appetite.

3.text: Don’t be desirous of his dainties, since they are deceitful food.

4.text: Don’t weary yourself to be rich. In your wisdom, show restraint.

5.text: Why do you set your eyes on that which is not? For it certainly sprouts wings like an eagle and flies in the sky.

6.text: Don’t eat the food of him who has a stingy eye, and don’t crave his delicacies:

7.text: for as he thinks about the cost, so he is. “Eat and drink!” he says to you, but his heart is not with you.

8.text: The morsel which you have eaten you shall vomit up, and lose your good words.

9.text: Don’t speak in the ears of a fool, for he will despise the wisdom of your words.

10.text: Don’t move the ancient boundary stone. Don’t encroach on the fields of the fatherless:

11.text: for their Defender is strong. He will plead their case against you.

12.text: Apply your heart to instruction, and your ears to the words of knowledge.

13.text: Don’t withhold correction from a child. If you punish him with the rod, he will not die.

14.text: Punish him with the rod, and save his soul from Sheol.

15.text: My son, if your heart is wise, then my heart will be glad, even mine:

16.text: yes, my heart will rejoice, when your lips speak what is right.

17.text: Don’t let your heart envy sinners; but rather fear Yahweh all the day long.

18.text: Indeed surely there is a future hope, and your hope will not be cut off.

19.text: Listen, my son, and be wise, and keep your heart on the right path!

20.text: Don’t be among ones drinking too much wine, or those who gorge themselves on meat:

21.text: for the drunkard and the glutton shall become poor; and drowsiness clothes them in rags.

22.text: Listen to your father who gave you life, and don’t despise your mother when she is old.

23.text: Buy the truth, and don’t sell it. Get wisdom, discipline, and understanding.

24.text: The father of the righteous has great joy. Whoever fathers a wise child delights in him.

25.text: Let your father and your mother be glad! Let her who bore you rejoice!

26.text: My son, give me your heart; and let your eyes keep in my ways.

27.text: For a prostitute is a deep pit; and a wayward wife is a narrow well.

28.text: Yes, she lies in wait like a robber, and increases the unfaithful among men.

29.text: Who has woe? Who has sorrow? Who has strife? Who has complaints? Who has needless bruises? Who has bloodshot eyes?

30.text: Those who stay long at the wine; those who go to seek out mixed wine.

31.text: Don’t look at the wine when it is red, when it sparkles in the cup, when it goes down smoothly.

32.text: In the end, it bites like a snake, and poisons like a viper.

33.text: Your eyes will see strange things, and your mind will imagine confusing things.

34.text: Yes, you will be as he who lies down in the midst of the sea, or as he who lies on top of the rigging:

35.text: “They hit me, and I was not hurt! They beat me, and I don’t feel it! When will I wake up? I can do it again. I can find another.”
